definition: Walter Mondale (1928-), US democratic politician, US vice-president 1977-1981 and ambassador to Japan 1993-1996
to deceive/to cheat/to hoodwink/to make a wild guess
blind/dim-sighted
Mongol ethnic group/abbr. for Mongolia 蒙古國|蒙古国[Meng3 gu3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Meng2]
(knocked) unconscious/dazed/stunned
to cover/ignorant/to suffer (misfortune)/to receive (a favor)/to cheat
surname Meng
drizzle/mist
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

thus/so/like that/you/thou

sentences.english: Mondale ended up losing the election in a landslide to Ronald Reagan.
sentences.chinese: 蒙代尔最后惨败给里根。

sentences.english: This is not to deny that Mr Mondale could make a fine president.
sentences.chinese: 我们不否认蒙代尔先生可以做一位好总统。

sentences.english: This is robert mundell's assignment rule .
sentences.chinese: 这就是罗伯特蒙代尔的分配原则。

sentences.english: I am grateful to Bob Mundell who, too, has spoken out loud on many occasions against significant appreciation of the RMB.
sentences.chinese: 感谢蒙代尔，他也曾多次大声疾呼地反对人民币升值。

sentences.english: It couldn't be determined if Mr. Mundell took part in or voted on such decisions.
sentences.chinese: 尚不清楚蒙代尔是否参与了或投票支持过这些决定。

sentences.english: Mondale laughed along with the audience.
sentences.chinese: 这句话让蒙代尔和观众们都笑了。

sentences.english: Mr. Mondale quoted from Truman in his speech.
sentences.chinese: 蒙代尔先生在讲话中引用了杜鲁门的话。

sentences.english: Ex. 10 Mondale has gone so far left that he left the United States.
sentences.chinese: 蒙代尔的观点如此之左，已经“左”出了美国。
